Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: Gregory Bogle
Reviews.Content: I had purchased a "no name" Android tablet for about half the price, but it locked up on me while installing an app (from the Google Playstore, no less) and I had to send it back to the factory for repair. This took about two months, so I decided to get a name brand tablet. I travel a lot and don't always have access to a WiFi network, so I wanted a device that can connect to a 3G network.As others have warned, it is not possible to start this tablet the first time without a SIM card inserted. Once I inserted a SIM card, the tablet started immediately. I then removed the SIM and I have been using it without the SIM in several European countries ever since.The Motorola Xoom MZ601 works smoothly, just as I expected. I also purchased the docking station and an external keyboard. the docking station includes a charger and the speaker sound is quite a bit better than the tablet's built-in speakers. I've used the keyboard just a few times, but it will take some time to learn its advantages - if there are any.Oh yes, I was able to "force" an upgrade to from Android 3.x Honeycomb to Android 4.0.3 Ice Cream Sandwich. I had to download several "upgrades" to Honeycomb, but then finally came the notification that ICS was available. All-in-all, it took about two hours, but it went very smoothly and everything works fine now.All-in-all, I think I made a good choice with this Motorola Xoom tablet.
